# ENCODER-AND-DECODER

The BigInt + TOTP Encoder and Decoder is a web-based tool built in HTML and JavaScript that allows users to encode and decode text securely using encryption based on large integers (BigInt) and time-based authentication (TOTP ‚Äì Time-Based One-Time Password).

üß© General Functioning
The system has two sections:

Encoder ‚Äì transforms text into an encrypted number (mixedBigInt in hexadecimal) and generates a secret key (TOTP Secret in base32).

Decoder ‚Äì reconstructs the original text using the mixedBigInt, the TOTP Secret, and a one-time code generated by an authenticator app (such as Google Authenticator).

üîí Main Technical Steps
The text is converted into bytes and then into a very large integer (BigInt).

A random secret (20 bytes) is created and converted into Base32, forming the TOTP Secret.

From this secret, the system derives a unique prime number used to mix with the original value ‚Äî the result is the mixedBigInt (encoded text).

To decode, the user needs the mixedBigInt, the TOTP Secret, and a valid TOTP code (generated every 30 seconds).

The system validates the TOTP code and, if correct, divides the mixedBigInt by the prime derived from the secret to recover the original text.

‚öôÔ∏è Main Technologies Used
Modern JavaScript (ES6+)

Web Crypto API ‚Äî for generating HMAC-SHA1 and SHA-256.

BigInt ‚Äî for performing operations with extremely large numbers.

Base32 ‚Äî for compatibility with authenticator apps.

üí° Purpose
The goal of this code is to secure textual data without transmitting or storing the original secret. It combines mathematical encoding and two-factor authentication (2FA), ensuring that only users who possess both the TOTP secret and a valid code can decrypt the content.

 

üîê Encoded Text
The text below is encoded.
To find out what it says, use the website at:
üëâ https://k10.netlify.app/projetos/esfera3d

üß© STEPS
1. Enter the mixedBigInt (hex) value into the decoder on the website.
2. Enter the TOTP Secret (base32) and input the required characters.
3. Register the TOTP Secret (base32) characters in your Authenticator app.

 
TOTP Secret (base32): ``` U6NGWOZC2I4E74QBDOMOQ473RN3V6AF5 ```

‚û°Ô∏è Use this TOTP in your Authenticator app.

4. Use the key generated by the Authenticator to continue.
